org.apache.juneau

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeanContext, Config, ConfigStore

    public abstract class Context
extends Object
    A reusable stateless thread-safe read-only configuration, typically used for creating one-time use Session objects.

    Contexts are created through the ContextBuilder.build() method (and subclasses of ContextBuilder).

    Subclasses MUST implement the following constructor:

    public T(PropertyStore);

    Besides that restriction, a context object can do anything you desire.
    However, it MUST be thread-safe and all fields should be declared final to prevent modification.
    It should NOT be used for storing temporary or state information.

    See Also:
    PropertyStore

      • getInstanceProperty

        public <T> T getInstanceProperty(String key,
                                 Class<T> type,
                                 Object def)
        Returns an instance of the specified class, string, or object property.

        If instantiating a class, assumes the class has a no-arg constructor. Otherwise, throws a runtime exception.

        Parameters:
        key - The property name.
        type - The class type of the property.
        def - The default value if the property doesn't exist.
        Can either be an instance of T, or a Class<? extends T>, or null.
        Returns:
        A new property instance.

      • getInstanceProperty

        public <T> T getInstanceProperty(String key,
                                 Class<T> type,
                                 Object def,
                                 boolean fuzzyArgs,
                                 Object... args)
        Returns an instance of the specified class, string, or object property.
        Parameters:
        key - The property name.
        type - The class type of the property.
        def - The default value if the property doesn't exist.
        Can either be an instance of T, or a Class<? extends T>.
        fuzzyArgs - Use fuzzy constructor arg matching.
        When true, constructor args can be in any order and extra args are ignored.
        No-arg constructors are also used if no other constructors are found.
        args - Arguments to pass to the constructor. Constructors matching the arguments are always used before no-arg constructors.
        Returns:
        A new property instance.

      • getInstanceProperty

        public <T> T getInstanceProperty(String key,
                                 Object outer,
                                 Class<T> type,
                                 Object def,
                                 boolean fuzzyArgs,
                                 Object... args)
        Returns an instance of the specified class, string, or object property.
        Parameters:
        key - The property name.
        outer - The outer object if the class we're instantiating is an inner class.
        type - The class type of the property.
        def - The default value if the property doesn't exist.
        Can either be an instance of T, or a Class<? extends T>.
        fuzzyArgs - Use fuzzy constructor arg matching.
        When true, constructor args can be in any order and extra args are ignored.
        No-arg constructors are also used if no other constructors are found.
        args - Arguments to pass to the constructor. Constructors matching the arguments are always used before no-arg constructors.
        Returns:
        A new property instance.

      • getPropertyKeys

        public Set<String> getPropertyKeys(String group)
        Returns the keys found in the specified property group.

        The keys are NOT prefixed with group names.

        Parameters:
        group - The group name.
        Returns:
        The set of property keys, or an empty set if the group was not found.

      • getPropertyStore

        @BeanIgnore
public final PropertyStore getPropertyStore()
        Returns the property store associated with this context.
        Returns:
        The property store associated with this context.

      • builder

        public ContextBuilder builder()
        Creates a builder from this context object.

        Builders are used to define new contexts (e.g. serializers, parsers) based on existing configurations.

        Returns:
        A new ContextBuilder object.

      • createSession

        public Session createSession()
        Create a new bean session based on the properties defined on this context.

        Use this method for creating sessions if you don't need to override any properties or locale/timezone currently set on this context.

        Returns:
        A new session object.

      • createSession

        public abstract Session createSession(SessionArgs args)
        Create a new session based on the properties defined on this context combined with the specified runtime args.

        Use this method for creating sessions if you don't need to override any properties or locale/timezone currently set on this context.

        Parameters:
        args - The session arguments.
        Returns:
        A new session object.

      • createDefaultSessionArgs

        public abstract SessionArgs createDefaultSessionArgs()
        Defines default session arguments used when calling the createSession() method.
        Returns:
        A SessionArgs object, possibly a read-only reusable instance.

      • asMap

        @BeanIgnore
public ObjectMap asMap()
        Returns the properties defined on this bean context as a simple map for debugging purposes.
        Returns:
        A new map containing the properties defined on this context.
